channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Campbell’s Soup fires exec after leaked recording berating ‘poor’ customers and ‘bioengineered meat’ prompts outrage and investigation
item.description: The comments were caught on a recording by a now-former employee.

item.title: Judge Dismisses Georgia Election Interference Case Against Trump
item.description: The president has now seen three criminal cases against him dissolve since he was re-elected last year.

item.title: Supreme Court to hear Texas landlord’s lawsuit against the Post Office for failing to deliver mail for 2 years
item.description: The DOJ argued that if the landlord wins, people will infer mail didn’t arrive “because of a rude comment that they heard, or what have you.”

item.title: Storms sweep from Houston to Minneapolis, complicating Thanksgiving travel for millions
item.description: Parts of western New York and northern Michigan are expected to see lake-effect snow Wednesday through Friday.

item.title: New York Sues Over Rule Barring Thousands of Immigrants From SNAP
item.description: The Trump administration says refugees and asylum seekers can never get food stamps, but attorneys general from New York and nearly two dozen other st...

item.title: Americans can’t agree on what ‘middle class’ means anymore, and they’re debating it in the comments of TikTok home tours
item.description: The "average" or "normal" home tour is fascinating, even dividing, thousands of Americans on TikTok who can't agree on social class.

item.title: ‘Low-hire, low-fire’ economy grinds on as lower-than-expected jobless claims suggests layoffs aren’t spiking
item.description: U.S. applications for unemployment benefits in the week ending Nov. 22 dropped 6,000 from the previous week to 216,000, the Labor Department reported.

item.title: ‘In Triage Every Day’: A Beleaguered Speaker Says He’s Overwhelmed
item.description: In a podcast interview, Speaker Mike Johnson opened up about the crushing demands of a job that he joked was his in name only.

item.title: Health Care, Ukraine Differences Roil a Chaotic G.O.P. Congress
item.description: Republican lawmakers and the White House have unloaded on one another as post-shutdown tension over policy and performance spreads across Capitol Hill...

item.title: The Loneliness of Using a Faith-Based Chatbot
item.description: Faith is not meant to be transactional or tailored to you.

item.title: U.K. Budget Plan Calms Markets and Labour Faithful. Will It Appeal to Voters?
item.description: The plan presented by the chancellor of the Exchequer, Rachel Reeves, called for spending increases and higher taxes on the wealthy and the middle cla...

item.title: Live Updates: Fire Engulfs Hong Kong Apartments, Killing 36 and Leaving Hundreds Missing
item.description: The police were investigating whether building and scaffolding materials contributed to the blaze's rapid spread in the city’s northern Tai Po distric...

item.title: Deadly, fast-moving fire is less likely in Midtown Manhattan, experts say.
item.description: The area’s high-rises have robust safety features and are not as densely packed as those in Hong Kong, making them less susceptible to blazes.

item.title: An Asia-Pacific Showdown
item.description: China and Japan are in a diplomatic feud over Taiwan, with President Trump in the middle.

item.title: Hong Kong Fire Shared Similarities With Grenfell Tower Fire in London
item.description: In the Grenfell Tower blaze, a combustible element called cladding that ran up the outside of the 24-story building allowed the fire to jump from floo...
